wiki.content: “BUTTERFLY EFFECT” is Travis Scott’s first solo release of 2017, serving as the lead single to his third studio album, ASTROWORLD, which released more than a year after this song. It is produced by Murda Beatz, who has worked with Travis previously, most notably on September 2016’s “sweet sweet” and “outside.” The “butterfly effect” is a concept that explains and proves how small causes can have large effects. Scott is also using a double-entendre with “butterfly” wherein, as he refers to the doors on his Lamborghini car; he also describes moving to his new life, how great it is, and how he could never go back to the old one. On May 15, 2017, Travis released the track on SoundCloud, along with two other songs: “A Man” and “Green & Purple (feat. Playboi Carti).” However, “BUTTERFLY EFFECT” was the only one out of the three songs that was released as a proper single onto streaming services. The official music video was released almost two months after, on July 13, 2017. Travis Scott first performed this song live on Wednesday night, 17th May for his Birds Eye View Tour in St. Louis. Travis also performed the song at the VMAs with 30 Seconds to Mars and solo (atop a flying bird) at the EMAs. “BUTTERFLY EFFECT” was certified RIAA Double Platinum on January 25th, 2018, debuting at number 99 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart and peaking at number 50 during the week of August 18th, 2018.
